intro: Staphidiastrum impetiolare, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and hairy surfaces. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to regions of Central and South America. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are small and yellow, often clustered in inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Staphidiastrum impetiolare is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in disturbed environments.
